spec.description: Metrics for transaction P2P gossip and the local view of mempool data

panels.description: Tracks the entries, byte size, failed inserts and file deletes of the blob store
panels.title: Blob store

panels.description: Tracks a heuristic of the memory footprint of the various transaction pool sub-pools
panels.title: Subpool Sizes in Bytes

panels.description: Transaction pool maintenance metrics
panels.title: TxPool Maintenance

panels.description: Tracks the number of transactions in the various transaction pool sub-pools
panels.title: Subpool Transaction Count

panels.description:
Tracks the number of transactions per second that are inserted and removed from the transaction pool, as well as the number of invalid transactions per second.

Bad transactions are a subset of invalid transactions, these will never be successfully imported. The remaining invalid transactions have a chance of being imported, for example transactions with nonce gaps.
panels.title: Inserted Transactions

panels.description: Number of transactions about to be imported into the pool.
panels.title: Pending Pool Imports

panels.description:
Tracks the number of incoming transaction messages in the channel from the network to the transaction pool.

Mempool messages sent over this channel are `GetPooledTransactions` requests, `NewPooledTransactionHashes` announcements (gossip), and `Transactions` (gossip)

Tx - `NetworkManager`
\nRx - `TransactionsManager`
panels.title: Incoming Gossip and Requests

panels.description: Measures the message send rate (MPS) for queued outgoing messages. Outgoing messages are added to the queue before being sent to other peers, and this metric helps track the rate of message dispatch.
panels.title: Queued Outgoing Messages

panels.description: All Transactions metrics
panels.title: All Transactions metrics

panels.description:
Egress RLPx capability traffic (default only `eth` capability)

Dropped - session channels are bounded, if there's no capacity, the message will be dropped.
panels.title: Outgoing Capability Messages

panels.description:
Total number of times a transaction is sent/announced that is already in the local pool.

This reflects the redundancy in the mempool.

targets.legendFormat: Freq Announced Transactions Already in Pool
Freq Received Transactions Already in Pool

panels.title: Frequency of Transactions Already in Pool

panels.description: Currently active outgoing GetPooledTransactions requests.
panels.title: Inflight Transaction Requests
Transactions Manager Poll Duration
Network Manager Poll Duration

panels.description:
Frequency of a peer sending a transaction that has already been marked as seen by that peer. This could for example be the case if a transaction is sent/announced to the peer at the same time that the peer sends/announces the same transaction to us.

This reflects the latency in the mempool.

targets.legendFormat: Freq Announced Transactions Already Seen by Peer
Freq Received Transactions Already Seen by Peer

panels.title: Frequency of Transactions Already Marked as Seen by Peer

panels.description: Number of all transactions of all sub-pools by type
panels.title: Transactions by Type in Pool

panels.description:
Duration of one call to `TransactionFetcher::on_fetch_pending_hashes`.

Find Peer - find an idle fallback peer for a hash pending fetch.

Fill Request - fill `GetPooledTransactions` request, for the found peer, with more hashes from cache of hashes pending fetch.
panels.title: Fetch Hashes Pending Fetch Duration

panels.description: Frequency of transaction types seen in announcements
panels.title: Announced Transactions by Type

panels.description: The number of tracked peers in the discovery modules (dnsdisc and discv4)
panels.title: Discovery: Tracked peers

panels.description: The number of incoming and outgoing connections, as well as the number of peers we are currently connected to. Outgoing and incoming connections also count peers we are trying to connect to.
panels.title: Connections

panels.description: Internal errors in the P2P module. These are expected to happen from time to time. High error rates should not cause alarm if the node is peering otherwise.
panels.title: P2P Errors

panels.description: Number of successful outgoing dial attempts.
panels.title: Total Dial Success

spec.title: reth-l2-mempool
